content.webTitle: Court postpones trial of Mbeki's former deputy

fields.headline: Court postpones trial of Mbeki's former deputy
fields.bodyText: The corruption trial of South Africa's former deputy president Jacob Zuma was postponed yesterday until November 12, while hundreds of supporters cheered him outside Durban magistrates' court. Mr Zuma was sacked by President Thabo Mbeki in June after his financial adviser was convicted of corruption, but he remains so popular that his impending court case has split the ANC. The state prosecution has requested more time for its investigation. Mr Zuma is facing two corruption charges, and further counts of fraud and perjury may be added.
